meanings.definition: A room where incoming and outgoing mail is processed and sorted.
meanings.sent1: The mailrooms in our office building are always busy with people sorting letters and packages.
meanings.sent2: I need to drop off this package at the mailrooms before the postman comes.
meanings.sent3: The mailrooms were so full of letters that they almost burst at the seams!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a bustling mailrooms, processing thoughts and ideas at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The mailrooms smelled of paper and ink, a familiar scent of organization and communication.

meanings.definition: The department responsible for handling mail within an organization.
meanings.sent1: The mailrooms at the company ensure that all letters and packages reach the right recipients.
meanings.sent2: She works in the mailrooms and is in charge of sorting and distributing all incoming mail.
meanings.sent3: The mailrooms team had a friendly competition to see who could sort the most mail in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The efficiency of the mailrooms was crucial for the smooth operation of the entire organization.
meanings.sent5: The mailrooms department was like a well-oiled machine, ensuring seamless communication flow.
